<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/25/unique-supply-chain-issues-cause-shortages-uk?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Anyone Know the Ted Lasso for Supply Chains?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/25/unique-supply-chain-issues-cause-shortages-uk?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Big Ben opened up to show its cogs" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzkxL2JpZ19iZW5fY29nc19pbl90aGVfY2xvY2tfc3VwcGx5X2NoYWluLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">McDonald’s <a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24856272.0/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25iYy5jb20vMjAyMS8wOC8yNS9tY2RvbmFsZHMtcnVucy1vdXQtb2YtbWlsa3NoYWtlcy1hcy1zdXBwbHktY2hhaW4td29lcy1ncmlwLXRoZS11ay5odG1sP3V0bV90ZXJtPUF1dG9mZWVkJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09U29jaWFsJnV0bV9jb250ZW50PU1haW4mdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1Ud2l0dGVy/5f10d6a212c71038741b0759Bef24f6ca?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24856272.0/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25iYy5jb20vMjAyMS8wOC8yNS9tY2RvbmFsZHMtcnVucy1vdXQtb2YtbWlsa3NoYWtlcy1hcy1zdXBwbHktY2hhaW4td29lcy1ncmlwLXRoZS11ay5odG1sP3V0bV90ZXJtPUF1dG9mZWVkJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09U29jaWFsJnV0bV9jb250ZW50PU1haW4mdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1Ud2l0dGVy/5f10d6a212c71038741b0759Bef24f6ca&source=gmail&ust=1630025150802000&usg=AFQjCNFlpp1B3iiiBT4QXQ25QH4JQtK7rw" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">can’t make</a> milkshakes in the UK, and it’s not because the machines are broken. It simply ran out. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The bigger picture: </strong>The UK is facing historic shortages across the board due to supply chain snags that are hitting the country harder than the White Queen clobbered Ron. A sampling:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Iconic halal chicken joint Nando’s is feeling </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/20/world/europe/nandos-chicken-shortage-closures-britain.html?campaign_id=4&emc=edit_dk_20210825&instance_id=38748&nl=dealbook&regi_id=99379353&segment_id=67150&te=1&user_id=0998aeca20eec25e9359bf7c26b01c43" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">less cheeky</a></span><span> after closing about 50 restaurants because of poultry shortages.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Supermarket chain Sainsbury's and other grocers are struggling to keep shelves stocked.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gas station pumps are running dry, compounding supply chain issues.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>One procurement industry leader </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-58304084?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the BBC</a></span><span> he’s seeing the “worst shortages of staff and materials on record.” </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These shortages are exacerbated by one broken cog in the supply chain: a lack of truck—err, lorry—drivers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And while driver shortages are a problem in many countries, the UK’s are due to a more <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/22/business/uk-covid-19-workers-pingdemic-scli-intl-gbr/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unusual set </a>of circumstances than just “the pandemic.” The two main causes:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. Brexit: </strong>Roughly 20,000 truck drivers originally from the EU left the UK after Brexit tightened up the country’s borders, an industry policy director told CNN. Those border restrictions have also made drivers wary of transporting goods from neighboring countries.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. The “pingdemic”: </strong>If you think HR pinging you on a Friday afternoon is scary, imagine receiving this…</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzkwL2Nsb3NlX2NvbnRhY3Rfbm90aWZpY2F0aW9uX2Zyb21fdWtfbmhzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Close contact notification from UK NHS" data-source="National Health Service" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s what the UK’s official Test and Trace app sends people if they come into close contact with someone who’s tested positive for Covid-19. Ignoring the message and heading to the pub or your lorry-driving job is illegal and can result in a fine ranging from £1,000–£10,000 (roughly $1,400 to $14,000).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the week of July 8–14, about 620,000 people across England and Wales received messages from the app telling them to self-isolate for ten days, per the UK’s National Health Association.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the UK government threw a plaster on its problem last Thursday, announcing that fully vaccinated workers would be exempt from the ping’s instructions. But the damage has been done, and the shortages are already taking a significant toll on the country's <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-58304084?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">economic rebound</a>. <em>– JW</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/25/delta-cracks-unvaccinated-employeesbut-doesnt-mandate-vaccinations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Delta Is Doing Something About Delta
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The airline is slapping a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/25/delta-air-lines-unvaccinated-employees-will-face-200-fees-if-they-dont-get-covid-vaccine.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$200 monthly surcharge</a> on the health insurance premiums of unvaccinated employees starting Nov. 1. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It comes down to “financial risk,” CEO Ed Bastian said. All Delta employees who’ve been hospitalized due to Covid were not fully vaccinated, and the average Covid-related hospitalization has cost the company <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/25/business/delta-covid-vaccine.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about $50,000/person</a>, Bastian said.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This unprecedented move by Delta came two days after the FDA gave full approval for Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine. And while the airline isn’t mandating vaccinations, it’s making life frustrating for employees who are unwilling to get the shot. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Airlines aren’t following the same playbook for vaccination policies.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>United is </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/06/united-airlines-vaccine-mandate-employees.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mandating vaccinations</a></span><span> of its employees within five weeks of the vaccine’s full approval. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>American Airlines, on the other hand, has said it will not require vaccinations. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Spirit’s decision has been delayed. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The aviation industry has a clear business interest in stamping out Covid. American Airlines <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/25/american-airlines-warns-covid-cases-weakening-bookings-and-revenue.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warned</a> yesterday that August revenue could be lower than expected, joining other carriers like Southwest that said the Delta-fueled wave was slowing demand for air travel. <em>– NF</em></p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/25/onlyfans-goes-back-proposed-porn-ban?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
OnlyFans Yesterday
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/25/onlyfans-goes-back-proposed-porn-ban?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="I've made a huge mistake meme from Arrested Development" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzkyL2lfdmVfbWFkZV9hX2h1Z2VfbWlzdGFrZV9tZW1lLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After its shocking <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/19/onlyfans-will-ban-sexually-explicit-content-surprising-pivot?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announcement</a> last week that it would ban sexually explicit content, OnlyFans flipped faster than any cast member of <em>Selling Sunset</em> when faced with confrontation. Yesterday, the adult entertainment platform reversed that policy change after facing <a href="https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-features/onlyfans-explicit-content-ban-response-1216466/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">backlash</a> for abandoning the sex workers who helped build the platform into a media behemoth. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The background:</strong> Founder and CEO Tim Stokely blamed pressure from banks for the initial ban, and specifically called out Bank of New York Mellon, Metro Bank, and JPMorgan Chase for creating obstacles to paying its adult creators the $300+ million they earn every month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">OnlyFans hasn’t said whether its relationship with banks has changed, but the problems it’s facing are nothing new in the adult entertainment industry. Last year, Mastercard and Visa banned the use of their cards on Pornhub, an adult video hosting site that we’ve never heard of until right now.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>for<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>creators dependent on a single site for income, the back and forth was a <a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/jg89mb/sex-workers-describe-the-instability-and-necessity-of-onlyfans?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wake up call</a> that they may need to diversify their distribution channels. <em>– MM</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Stop What You’re Doing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5stocks-again?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-again&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0500001&psource=esamnbwdg0500001&wsource=esamnbwdg0500001" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Motley Fool" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media2.morningbrew.com/uploads/placement/images/2165/1628539003-People-157.jpg">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And look at this guy in the photo. He’s wearing a two-piece<em> </em>suit and there’s money (<em>money</em>!) falling all around him. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How did he get there? Well, we can’t say for certain, but we have a hunch it has something to do with the stock aficionados at <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5stocks-again?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-again&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0500001&psource=esamnbwdg0500001&wsource=esamnbwdg0500001" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool</a>. They just released 5 stocks that they think are screaming (in a good way) for investors to buy them. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And if you’re feeling skeptical, let’s take a look down memory stock lane where the Motley Fool led investors to some <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5stocks-again?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-again&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0500001&psource=esamnbwdg0500001&wsource=esamnbwdg0500001" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">life changing investment returns</a>. We’re talking about companies like:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Amazon (on 9/6/2002), you’d be up</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> 21,748%</strong></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Netflix (on 12/15/2004), you’d be up</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> 27,973%</strong></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of course, not all of their picks have performed as well, but don’t get stock fomo when you could be jumping for stock joy in a suit. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5stocks-again?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5stocksunder50-again&aid=9394&paid=9394&waid=9394&source=esamnbwdg0500001&psource=esamnbwdg0500001&wsource=esamnbwdg0500001" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Learn more today</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/25/joe-rogan-influence-diminished-move-spotify-verge-reports?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Has Anyone Seen This Man?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/25/joe-rogan-influence-diminished-move-spotify-verge-reports?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Joe Rogan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDEyL2pvZV9yb2dhbi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Michael S. Schwartz/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Joe Rogan shook up the podcasting world when he brought his megapopular show exclusively to Spotify in a deal worth a reported $100 million. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How’s that going for him?</strong> Could be better, according to an <a href="https://www.theverge.com/22632213/joe-rogan-experience-spotify-exclusive-audience-reach?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investigation</a> by The Verge. Using secondary metrics, like how much of a promotional boost Rogan gave his guests, The Verge found that Rogan’s influence has diminished since he went to frolic in Spotify’s walled garden.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some of the evidence: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Before the Spotify move, Rogan’s smaller guests could expect to add 4,000 Twitter followers/week after appearing on the show. Since he went to Spotify, that number has dropped to 2,000.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Rogan’s YouTube channel, which used to post full pod episodes but hasn’t since the switch, is growing more slowly.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Google searches for Rogan are down this year from 2020.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>As scientists would say, there are numerous confounding variables that could help explain a dip in enthusiasm for the podcast. But as Spotify tries to bring on more high-profile podcasts to its platform (like it just did with <em>Call Her Daddy</em>), podcasters might increasingly question whether Spotify’s $$$ is worth limiting their exposure on other platforms. <em>– NF</em></p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>This puzzle is a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/25/brew-mini-work-art?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">work of art</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than a compliment for a bucket hat. Can you guess the odd one out?</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Eggo just </span><span><a href="https://vegnews.com/2021/8/eggo-meatless-chicken-waffles?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a></span><span> its first meatless chicken and waffles</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Nirvana </span><span><a href="https://pitchfork.com/news/nirvana-sued-by-baby-from-nevermind-album-artwork-for-child-pornography/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sued</a></span><span><span> by baby from </span></span><span><em>Nevermind</em></span><span><span> album artwork for child pornography</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tony Hawk's blood is being used in $500 limited-edition </span><span><a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/2021/08/25/tony-hawk-liquid-death-sell-blood-infused-skateboard-decks/5586588001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">skateboards</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Feral cats </span><span><a href="https://media2.giphy.com/media/BzyTuYCmvSORqs1ABM/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47l4hrb3opj61efe65bp3ecgdob0prwt63ojuvyfxf&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">responsible</a></span><span><span> for more paused baseball games than storms in Chicago</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMcDonald’s \u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24856272.0/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuY25iYy5jb20vMjAyMS8wOC8yNS9tY2RvbmFsZHMtcnVucy1vdXQtb2YtbWlsa3NoYWtlcy1hcy1zdXBwbHktY2hhaW4td29lcy1ncmlwLXRoZS11ay5odG1sP3V0bV90ZXJtPUF1dG9mZWVkJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09U29jaWFsJnV0bV9jb250ZW50PU1haW4mdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1Ud2l0dGVy/5f10d6a212c71038741b0759Bef24f6ca?utm_source=morning_brew\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecan’t make\u003c/a\u003e milkshakes in the UK, and it’s not because the machines are broken. It simply ran out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe bigger picture: \u003c/strong\u003eThe UK is facing historic shortages across the board due to supply chain snags that are hitting the country harder than the White Queen clobbered Ron. A sampling:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIconic halal chicken joint Nando’s is feeling \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/20/world/europe/nandos-chicken-shortage-closures-britain.html?campaign_id=4\u0026emc=edit_dk_20210825\u0026instance_id=38748\u0026nl=dealbook\u0026regi_id=99379353\u0026segment_id=67150\u0026te=1\u0026user_id=0998aeca20eec25e9359bf7c26b01c43\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eless cheeky\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e after closing about 50 restaurants because of poultry shortages.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSupermarket chain Sainsbury's and other grocers are struggling to keep shelves stocked.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGas station pumps are running dry, compounding supply chain issues.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOne procurement industry leader \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-58304084?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the BBC\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e he’s seeing the “worst shortages of staff and materials on record.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese shortages are exacerbated by one broken cog in the supply chain: a lack of truck—err, lorry—drivers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd while driver shortages are a problem in many countries, the UK’s are due to a more \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/22/business/uk-covid-19-workers-pingdemic-scli-intl-gbr/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunusual set \u003c/a\u003eof circumstances than just “the pandemic.” The two main causes:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1. Brexit: \u003c/strong\u003eRoughly 20,000 truck drivers originally from the EU left the UK after Brexit tightened up the country’s borders, an industry policy director told CNN. Those border restrictions have also made drivers wary of transporting goods from neighboring countries.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2. The “pingdemic”: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you think HR pinging you on a Friday afternoon is scary, imagine receiving this…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MzkwL2Nsb3NlX2NvbnRhY3Rfbm90aWZpY2F0aW9uX2Zyb21fdWtfbmhzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiJ9\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"Close contact notification from UK NHS\" data-source=\"National Health Service\" data-reactroot=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s what the UK’s official Test and Trace app sends people if they come into close contact with someone who’s tested positive for Covid-19. Ignoring the message and heading to the pub or your lorry-driving job is illegal and can result in a fine ranging from £1,000–£10,000 (roughly $1,400 to $14,000).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn the week of July 8–14, about 620,000 people across England and Wales received messages from the app telling them to self-isolate for ten days, per the UK’s National Health Association.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe UK government threw a plaster on its problem last Thursday, announcing that fully vaccinated workers would be exempt from the ping’s instructions. But the damage has been done, and the shortages are already taking a significant toll on the country's \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-58304084?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeconomic rebound\u003c/a\u003e. \u003cem\u003e– Delta\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe airline is slapping a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/25/delta-air-lines-unvaccinated-employees-will-face-200-fees-if-they-dont-get-covid-vaccine.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$200 monthly surcharge\u003c/a\u003e on the health insurance premiums of unvaccinated employees starting Nov. 1. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt comes down to “financial risk,” CEO Ed Bastian said. All Delta employees who’ve been hospitalized due to Covid were not fully vaccinated, and the average Covid-related hospitalization has cost the company \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/25/business/delta-covid-vaccine.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eabout $50,000/person\u003c/a\u003e, Bastian said.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis unprecedented move by Delta came two days after the FDA gave full approval for Pfizer’s Covid-19 vaccine. And while the airline isn’t mandating vaccinations, it’s making life frustrating for employees who are unwilling to get the shot. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eAirlines aren’t following the same playbook for vaccination policies.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eUnited is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/06/united-airlines-vaccine-mandate-employees.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emandating vaccinations\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of its employees within five weeks of the vaccine’s full approval. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAmerican Airlines, on the other hand, has said it will not require vaccinations. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpirit’s decision has been delayed. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe aviation industry has a clear business interest in stamping out Covid. American Airlines \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/25/american-airlines-warns-covid-cases-weakening-bookings-and-revenue.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewarned\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that August revenue could be lower than expected, joining other carriers like Southwest that said the Delta-fueled wave was slowing demand for air travel. \u003cem\u003e– NF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMichael S. Schwartz/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJoe Rogan shook up the podcasting world when he brought his megapopular show exclusively to Spotify in a deal worth a reported $100 million. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow’s that going for him?\u003c/strong\u003e Could be better, according to an \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/22632213/joe-rogan-experience-spotify-exclusive-audience-reach?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvestigation\u003c/a\u003e by The Verge. Using secondary metrics, like how much of a promotional boost Rogan gave his guests, The Verge found that Rogan’s influence has diminished since he went to frolic in Spotify’s walled garden.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome of the evidence: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBefore the Spotify move, Rogan’s smaller guests could expect to add 4,000 Twitter followers/week after appearing on the show. Since he went to Spotify, that number has dropped to 2,000.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRogan’s YouTube channel, which used to post full pod episodes but hasn’t since the switch, is growing more slowly.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGoogle searches for Rogan are down this year from 2020.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eAs scientists would say, there are numerous confounding variables that could help explain a dip in enthusiasm for the podcast. But as Spotify tries to bring on more high-profile podcasts to its platform (like it just did with \u003cem\u003eCall Her Daddy\u003c/em\u003e), podcasters might increasingly question whether
